thread.title: RBA's Glenn Stevens 'pretty content' with local interest rates now
thread.title_full: RBA's Glenn Stevens 'pretty content' with local interest rates now

author: Peter Martin
title: RBA's Glenn Stevens 'pretty content' with local interest rates now
text:
Governor Glenn Stevens told a parliamentary hearing on Friday morning that Australia had managed to survive the mining boom without either a spike in inflation or a sudden slump in economic growth. Photo: Glenn Hunt
Peter Martin: RBA sees US rate rise by Christmas Michael Pascoe: Dear Janet, if not now, when? Malcolm Maiden: Sharemarket turmoil helped sway the Fed Fed leaves interest rates on hold Wild ride for $A after Fed decision The Reserve Bank has poured cold water on speculation about a further cut in Australian interest rates, saying it is "pretty content" with where they are now.
Governor Glenn Stevens told a parliamentary hearing on Friday morning that Australia had managed to survive the mining boom without either a spike in inflation or a sudden slump in economic growth.
"There is still a pretty good chance that we will come out of this episode fairly well, and much better than we came out of previous episodes of this type," he said.
Advertisement "We're pretty content where we are now".
Mr Stevens expected an increase in the US interest rates "by Christmas" . The US Federal Reserve left its key funds rate on hold on Friday morning, Australian time, defying markets and many pundits who expected a cut.
He signalled that he wasn't particularly concerned about the recent slide in the Australian dollar , saying the dollar would normally be expected to fall after a period of sliding commodity prices and that was exactly what was happening.
